summary: Build an aptitude website with separate access for admins and students.
architectural_notes: Initial deployment/admin bootstrap: set the current authenticated user (the requester) as the initial Admin principal for the website.

existing_features.title: Implement authentication using Internet Identity and provide a clear sign-in/sign-out UX for the aptitude website.
Add role-based access control with two roles: Admin and Student. Store and enforce roles in the Motoko backend so that Admin-only actions cannot be performed by Students.

Create separate application areas (routes/pages) for Admin and Student access, including an Admin Dashboard and a Student Dashboard, with navigation that only shows links relevant to the signed-in userâ€™s role.
Define a minimal aptitude-test domain model to support the website purpose: Admin can create/edit/delete aptitude questions; Students can list questions and take a basic quiz attempt with scoring.

Apply a coherent visual theme and layout across the app (landing, dashboards, forms, tables) using Tailwind + shadcn components, with a distinct style appropriate for an aptitude/education site (avoid blue & purple as the primary palette).
Add a frontend UI flow that allows an authenticated user to become the initial Admin when (and only when) no Admin has been initialized yet.

new_feature_requests.summary: Implement role-based access with separate admin and student logins/permissions for the aptitude website

Provide an Admin role bootstrap flow so the app can be initialized: on first deploy, allow a secure mechanism to set the initial Admin principal (e.g., first authenticated user becomes Admin, or a single explicit backend initializer method).
Add a secure backend bootstrap mechanism to assign the initial Admin role to the first user who claims it, so the app can be initialized after deployment.
